page.title: 09THE SCHOOL IN PLYMTREE
page.content: Built in 1873 this two teacher Victorian school was under threat of closure in 1983. Village action group managed to delay the closure by a two year review. During this time the school had to show that it was educa- tionally and financially viable. In January 1985 the school achieved this objective and now has 41 pupils. A further classroom is being added and numbers will hopefully rise to 60+ so necessitating a third teacher. The school at present is divided into two classes, Class 1 for 5-7s, Class 2 for 7-11s. The school day begins at 9am & ends at 3.30pm. After school clubs include Chess, Music, Netball & Football. Parents help voluntarily to further the education of their child- ren and the very active PTA holds many fund-raising events. The school is totally integrated into the community.
